¬†Alright Guys it's really Hard to know things about a machine in 1-2 days But still if you reading this means you really need an advice.# i bought this Renewed laptop few days back and First product i got wasn't working quite well. So i called technician visit through amazon that too 2 times and guys """ Amazon technicians  Do Not come instead  they'll want you to lie with customer support. They are worthless. Then i raise complaint with Amazon.AMAZON CUSTOMER SUPPORT Always maintain it's standards and services. they helped me getting a replacement from SYNTRONICS OFFICIAL (seller).I got almost new like laptop Dell e5470 latitude with better Processor i5 6th gen 6440HQ with windows 11 pro and charger. But it was inconvenient why couldn't they send me this one in the first time.Points to remember ---1--- Always look for a good seller (most important)  Search it or do some R&D2-- Use the product even if you don't have to. because then only you would know if there's any problem.3--- Do Not rely on Technician complaint raised by amazon because they'll not do any good. Use amazon customer support instead.4- You may get a used laptop like really used . watch for it.5- it's my first renewed product after replacement i am satisfied so far.6-- Keep one thing in mind if the laptop stops working or showing any symptoms of that after 7 days so you'll have to fix it on your own because i don't they will send someone who could fix it this warranty n all that may not work for you.7--- You have 7 days to judge the product. after that you're on your own almost. (i ordered technical visit 2 times no one came)8- Guys it's worth a shot but for those like me (risk takers)PERFORMANCE---1-- really nice,  this latitude laptop will not disappoint you2-  fine browsing, speed, no heat at all, heavy business work, daily things and rendering also covered.3-- performance wise no complaint so far with REPLACEMENT ONE"4- Everything is original.5-- Screen is really good man..6- this is much much better that those 40k 45k laptops only if you get a fine condition product. litlt luck required.7-- Camara is fine , display awesome, processor powerful8-- i got it for 24k somthing.9- you can't ask much if you get a fine condition laptop in the first time.10-- LOOK FOR THE SELLER PLEASE. Do not order unless you trust the seller. I am thankful to Amazon customer support they helped me get a fine condition laptop.Conclusion ---Wanna save the money, you gotta take a little pain and risk. Make your mind first.

Product: (Renewed) Dell Latitude E5470 Intel Core i5 6th Gen.6200u Processor 14.1 Inches HD Screen Notebook Computer (8 GB Ram & 256 GB SSD, Windows 10 Pro, 1.71Kg)
(Renewed) Dell Latitude E5470 Intel Core i5 6th Gen.6200u Processor 14.1 Inches HD Screen Notebook Computer (8 GB Ram & 256 GB SSD, Windows 10 Pro, 1.71Kg)
Review: Package was delivered smoothly no issues at all very well packed. When I opened the package and turned on the laptop it simply said no bootable device found (which meant there was no hard drive in it) I contacted Amazon customer service they filed an investigation on that rather than offering me a refund on return or a replacement and asked me to wait for almost 7-10 working days. Later that day I reached out to the seller he told me to get it checked at Dell store. I went there they opened and checked the hard drive was no properly attached and was loosened. Dell store fixed it I have to pay the charges as it was renewed so they didn't cover it under warranty or so. Later down the week the laptop was not getting turned on ( the motherboard was dead, post verifying it with Dell I reached amazon) I again contacted Amazon customer service they simply said return window is closed no actions can be taken. Without any second doubt without asking and listening to my perspective they slapped resolution on my face that no actions can be taken. The way of communicating this was way too rude!! Amazon has hired a bunch on incompetent individuals who are not capable enough to be in a customer service industry. They're not even following the basic Amazon contact tenets. Long story short I'm still following up with the seller to get it replaced or refunded. Indeed Amazon India services are declining drastically. They're not earth's most customer centric company anymore! It's my humble request to you people please do not buy a renewed product!

Product: (Renewed) Dell Latitude E5470 Intel Core i5 6th Gen.6200u Processor 14.1 Inches HD Screen Notebook Computer (8 GB Ram & 256 GB SSD, Windows 10 Pro, 1.71Kg)
Review: The PC itself is good but the vendor has unknowingly or deliberately messed up the refurbishment. The keyboard is completely rubbish. The second row of keys from the top (with numbers) and symbols are mis-matched. Specifically,  keys with numerals 6 onwards have symbols on them that are not seen on any standard keyboard. For example key 6 has the symbol & whereas in a standard key 6 comes with the symbol ^All the keys after 6 have this issue as also symbol keys near the ENTER key and shift key on the right hand side of the keyboard.I am surprised that anyone in their right mind would sell such a PC.Amazon has very kindly agreed to replace but I strongly suspect it will have the same issue. Keep tuned!!UPDATEThe replacement arrived today and within 10 minutes decided to return it. The keyboard was right but System properties showed that the OS was Windows 10 Home instead of Windows 10 ProI would highly recommend not to buy anything from the vendor USEDBUTNEW. Either he is unqualified to refurbish or is doing this deliberately, selling bad PCs.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 Intel Celeron N4020 4th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (8GB/256GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/2Yr Warranty/3months Game Pass/Platinum Grey/1.7Kg), 81WQ00MQIN
Review: At features and price, this is a good laptop. The screen quality is decent and the setup is convenient. This is running Celeron, so obviously there's no gaming for this machine. It's unfortunate, but that three month game pass is pretty much useless. MS Office setup is easy and straightforward.There are a few negatives. First, the wire going from the laptop to the screen is very visible at the hinge. This is a potential point of failure and I think it will affect the life of the laptop.Another annoying aspect is the continuous upselling attempts by Lenovo. The laptop includes Lenovo Vantage software, which could be necessary for some aspects like firmware updates. However, Lenovo keeps pushing users to buy additional software coverage, including by throwing popups on the screen while you work.Some annoying issues, but I think it's overall a good laptop.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 Intel Celeron N4020 4th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (8GB/256GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/2Yr Warranty/3months Game Pass/Platinum Grey/1.7Kg), 81WQ00MQIN

Review: Read till the end.Reviewing after 12 days of usage.If your budget is around 27k and not purchasing for gaming then you should difinitely go for it. There are hardly any cons in this product.#Built quality is upto the mark.#Looks and feels premium like a 40k laptop#Fingerprint sensor is what makes it different.#Processing speed is fluent.#Camera is ok ok (enough).#Touchpad feels premium.#SSD makes it a bit more buttery.#Display quality is more than good in this budget.The only problem i faced is regarding MS office as OFFICE 365 is pre installed without the activation key as a result we cant access it or we have to purchase it. But fortunately i installed MS office 2021 from external source in minutes so not a big deal.So i would suggest everyone to go for it blindly and save some pennies without any disappointment cz i have been searching for laptop since 1 month and this fulfilled my all my requirements. Thank you

¬†This is such a premium looking laptop at this price point. Extremely light weight, classy looking body and keyboard, ssd boot, pre-installed windows 10, fingerprint recognition along with new features from the updated os. Can't believe something so good can be available at this price point. The boot time is significantly fast than other laptops, comparable with macbook. Review: Read till the end.Reviewing after 12 days of usage.If your budget is around 27k and not purchasing for gaming then you should difinitely go for it. There are hardly any cons in this product.#Built quality is upto the mark.#Looks and feels premium like a 40k laptop#Fingerprint sensor is what makes it different.#Processing speed is fluent.#Camera is ok ok (enough).#Touchpad feels premium.#SSD makes it a bit more buttery.#Display quality is more than good in this budget.The only problem i faced is regarding MS office as OFFICE 365 is pre installed without the activation key as a result we cant access it or we have to purchase it. But fortunately i installed MS office 2021 from external source in minutes so not a big deal.So i would suggest everyone to go for it blindly and save some pennies without any disappointment cz i have been searching for laptop since 1 month and this fulfilled my all my requirements. Thank you

¬†This is such a premium looking laptop at this price point. Extremely light weight, classy looking body and keyboard, ssd boot, pre-installed windows 10, fingerprint recognition along with new features from the updated os. Can't believe something so good can be available at this price point. The boot time is significantly fast than other laptops, comparable with macbook. Review: This is a Celeron machine so the performance is low as compared with i3s or i5s. I was looking for something handy and economical. So it serves the purpose.There are some comments about the warranty issue, it's right you will see less month remaining but there are 2 things, Amazon assures that your device will get covered, and also you can contact Lenovo and get it revised as per your purchased date, it will take about 24-48 hours.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad D330 Intel Celeron N4020 10.1" (25cm) HD IPS Detachable 2-in-1 Laptop (4GB/128GB eMMC/Windows 10/1 Yr Warranty/Mineral Grey/1.1Kg), 82H0001YIN
Review: This is one good looking laptop. It's light, sufficiently powerful to run office and some light apps with email (i use it as a travel machine, so that is all i need to do with it. If i need to do other coding related work i use it to RDP into my work desktop). I recommended this to four other people two of which are students and use it heavily for taking notes, attending classes etc., and i have not heard them complain once. Excellent battery life.One issue with the newer models is that they don't charge over USB c. My nephew has a older model of the same laptop which charges over USB c. Maybe this is some cost cutting gimick Lenovo has started pulling. Also my laptop shows no indication that it is charging when it is powered off. For my newphews machine, the led is on when it charges. There is also slight light bleed on my lcd from right right edge when the screen is pitch black but for all other laptops this problem doesnt exist. None of these are major issues but please be aware that Lenovo is pulling cost cutting gimicks in the new model.Overall I would highly recommend this because if you are looking for a small laptop or two in one which is light and portable, there is literally nothing else in market that you can buy in this price range.Some people use iPad or Android tablets for on the go work but I just could not do it. Bad software support on both (stripped down version of office, no support for wine on Android) and clunkly folio cases with bad keyboard and no mouse pad make tablets a really bad decission for anything other than content consumption and note taking with a stylus. You should only buy a tablet if those are your use cases. This machine though is the best of both worlds. With 7 to 8 hours of battery life it can pretty much couple up as a tablet.There was a time when this machine used to come with free active stylus. Now, it doesn't. I don't even know if it supports stylus any more, since Lenovo seems to have gone completely silent about it in documentation.All told if you are looking for a probable laptop to do some light but real work using Microsoft office, obsedian, notion etc. and have budget of twenty K this is what you want to buy. If you are a student with typical student use cases and don't want to play demanding games, again buy this machine. If you want to buy laptops for elders in the house, buy this laptop. Hope this clarifies and helps people make a decission depending on their use case.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad D330 Intel Celeron N4020 10.1" (25cm) HD IPS Detachable 2-in-1 Laptop (4GB/128GB eMMC/Windows 10/1 Yr Warranty/Mineral Grey/1.1Kg), 82H0001YIN
Review: I'm going to leave an HONEST REVIEW, I read others, and some people commented about flaws of multitasking, speed being slow etc. etc. I haven't purchased a LENOVO laptop ever in my life, THIS IS MY VERY FIRST LENOVO PURCHASE, so this review is completely UNBIASED....so let me run a detailed review at a price point of about 20k and small ram and storage, I bought this simply for basic purposes (youtube, writing, social media, emails etc.)Screen: BEAUTIFUL, runs 1080p wonderfully, produces a good picture AND IS TOUCHSCREEN WITH DETACHABLE FEATURE MAKING IT A TABLET!MultiTasking: I currently have whatsapp running, 8 tabs open in chrome (1 which is facebook, 2 are youtube, 1 is insta etc. and I have edge open) IT IS RUNNING SMOOTHLY. It is a mini powerhouse and is running beautifullyDetachable keyboard: works like a charm and has nice keys, the screen pops in like a puzzle/lego peiceAnother beautiful benefit is there's no huge laptop kind of fan / outlet! LESS NOISE! LESS HEAT!Battery lasts very long 8 hours give or take depending on what you're using it for (videos and streaming naturally will use more battery)Speakers: On the Standard Size, but it is Tablet like, so that is to be expected, sounds like a standard tablet/mobile phone but audio quality is quite crisp and enhanced, but you won't get surround sound deep bass effect.It is not meant for gaming, so don't give it aa bad review if it can't run your favorite games, it is a budget laptop that is extremely mobile, extremely portable 2 in 1 type, perfect for web browsing, video watching, email checking, word processing etc. I gave it 5 stars because it met all my requirements and the screen is absolutely beautiful! Runs 1080p videos crystal clear!

Review: This laptop is drop-dead amazing and it's amazing for the price it has 16GB of 2400mhz ram and 512GB ValueTech SSD which is not the best but better than an HDD the display is clear as crystal and the fact love the most it has face recognition feature and an i5 8th gen CPU which is good for my needs (A bit gaming, work, movie's, etc...). The thing I had expected was a lot of damage but all I found was a bit of scratch on the bottom which is reasonable considering it's a laptop and it had a bit of dust I can just clean it so not the end of the world. Anyways all I wanted to say was I absolutely love the laptop and would absolutely recommend this laptop for basic needs or small gaming sessions idk do what you do.

Product: Acer Extensa 15 Lightweight Laptop 11th Gen Intel Core i3 Processor with 15.6" (39.6 cms) Full HD Display- (8 GB RAM/256GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/Intel UHD Graphics /1.7Kg/Black) EX215-54
Review: Everything  good in this laptop

Product: Acer Extensa 15 Lightweight Laptop 11th Gen Intel Core i3 Processor with 15.6" (39.6 cms) Full HD Display- (8 GB RAM/256GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/Intel UHD Graphics /1.7Kg/Black) EX215-54
Review: Well, it may or may not be the future of laptops, but on this one at least you are stuckup with win11 home to the end it seems as you cannot boot from any other device (usb flash / dvd drives) unless it is a rescue disc created by the running win 11 system, the bios boot option is one and only one "windows boot manager'!  which in itself is not a device and you cannot change this by any means (I have tried all possible ways, it is not possible)  so if you are happy with it, then purchase it else not.Performance as it is can be termed as very goodMs Office home , norton antivirus is pre installed without license so you have to purchase a license key additionally if you wish to use these beyond the trial period of a few daysI am totally disappointed not for the performance but because I like to be in full control of the device which in this case is not possible so only 2 stars for the product as it boots up and shuts down as expected off an ssd.After 2 days of struggle I called acer service  to make it possible to boot from usb devices and the service person visited and  whatever he tried (mostly changes in bios security settings) simply made the pre loaded win 11 also non bootable and not repairable, as per my habit I had a rescue disk already made out of the installed system and a backup image prepared from the win 11 in spite of which the operating system remained useless and I had to go back to a fresh install of windows 10 from my own win 10 install media and then upgrade to win 11.After 2 months :After lot many tries I've found out that fedora 34 onwards can be installed from usb drives on this hardware and may be other uefi compatible ones too may get working on it. The performance is fine so I am increasing the rating from 2 to 4 stars now, 1 star less for absence of "caps lock, num lock, BT etc. " indicators on kbd and a narrow viewing angle for the quality FHD (1920 X 1080)  resolution .

Product: HP Chromebook 11a, MediaTek MT8183 Processor 11.6 inch(29.5 cm) Thin and Light Touchscreen Laptop (4 GB RAM/64 GB eMMC/ Chrome OS /Fast Charge/Google Assistant/Indigo Blue/1.07Kg), na0002MU, 1.07Kg
Review: Got it for 15.2 K on sale. At that price, it‚Äôs a real value for money product.Installing android apps is easy through Google play store but initially had some problem setting up Linux. The Chrome OS initially did not detect any update but then updated itself after I left it connected to wifi for about 3 hrs. Installing Linux was easy after it updated to latest Chrome OS version. Linux version is Debian 11 (bullseye), arm64.  Setting up Linux would require some initial knowledge of CLI terminal. After installing Linux, installed software center, GIMP and Libreoffice in it. Was also able to install several other Linux apps by downloading the Debian package. Once installed, Linux apps work just as any other installed apps, though sometimes take 3-4 seconds for initial launch. But for some reason, Wine did not function, so no windows app. The Chrome browser works in full desktop mode.Initially had about 42 GB of free space of which 10 GB had to be given to Linux. Considering the limited storage, files would have to be stored to either Google drive or other online storage. Battery backup is good, about 8-12 hrs, depending upon use. USB-C charger and can be even charged with high wattage mobile chargers. But display is not so crisp, considering the price, that is normal I guess. Keys have good feeling but not backlit. Trackpad is reasonably responsive, but touchscreen is not so responsive at times. Weight without charger is about 1 Kg. Boots and switches off in  few seconds, through can be left without turning off.With both android apps and Linux apps (particularly Libreoffice) installed, can be a very effective replacement for normal computing requirements, media consumption, online classes and office work, particularly while travelling, but only if one is able to utilize the Linux features.

Product: HP Chromebook 11a, MediaTek MT8183 Processor 11.6 inch(29.5 cm) Thin and Light Touchscreen Laptop (4 GB RAM/64 GB eMMC/ Chrome OS /Fast Charge/Google Assistant/Indigo Blue/1.07Kg), na0002MU, 1.07Kg
Review: First thing, it is a Chromebook, so no point thinking it as a substitute for laptop. This is an entry-level complete package for students or casual users who mostly focus on browsing, writing or watching movies. Easy to carry and is right for travel as it has 8+ hours battery life. This has a touch screen which makes it more loveable but the touch is not so smooth compared to 40k+ laptops. Initially the 11-inch look was repulsive, but one will get accustomed to it and my daughter thinks the smaller look makes it cuter.Overall it‚Äôs a value for money. Definitely an affordable option for students.

Product: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Response Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
Review: I bought this laptop for 85k the performance is good but the build quality is not up to mark.There is rog strix for 90k with ryzen 7 6800h in which you will get better build quality but a little bit of compromise in performance of cpu its a little bit and you get more tgp(95w) for the graphics card. I bought victus over strix for that little bit of performance. The compromise in victus is the build quality and gpu tgp(75w).If you want a laptop purely for gaming just go for strix

Product: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Response Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
Review: I was searching for a laptop which would serve me for long time. My last laptop was HP pavilion 15 and served me for 9 yrs and still running. My requirement was to get a laptop which would serve me for long time. I am not a regular game player. So, I looked for all options. Dell G 15 was on cards however when i was doing research I found out that at same price I was getting an i7 12 gen. I ordered this beast. Specs wise it's an i7 12th gen, RTX3050 4 GB, 512 GB SSD, 8 GB ram, 15,6 inch with a 144 Hz refresh rate. I chose to exchange an old dell laptop and got another discount of 10% on sbi credit card during ongoing sale. Exchange value was also decent.thanks to amazon for amazing delivery and exchange experience. I got the laptop in 3 days.I am not a professional user of a laptop however as soon as I got it, I edited few Go Pro videos and few dashcam videos. Soon after that I handled video editing for some work. This laptop worked like a breeze. It handled all the huge sized videos with ease. I also used it to project the display onto a data wall and to my surprise, it extended the display instead of normal duplication. It made my work easy as i was able to do my work in background without anyone in audience knowing about it. Till now its a great experience, Battery life is obviously lesser due to i7 and GPU but gaming laptops will have lesser battery life anyway. The display screen is also good. It did not hurt my eyes even after long working on the screen. It looks and feels good. Its not flimsy, it looks very dated and has a good venting and cooling system. It has a backlight keyboard as well and comes with office and windows 10 preloaded.Its a must buy and, in this price, its a win win situation.

¬†Very efficient and inexpensive gaming laptop at this price point. I purchased it in the amazon prime day sale for ‚Çπ58000 after exchanging my old laptop. Games run smoothly on this laptop. Played RDR2 on this laptop. Although RDR2 requires minimum 12 GB RAM, this laptop played it smoothly with 8gb ram. Product: HP Victus Gaming Latest 12th Gen Intel Core i7 15.6 inch(39.6 cm) FHD Gaming Laptop (8GB RAM/512GB SSD/RTX 3050 4GB Graphics/144Hz/9ms Response Time/Win 11/MSO/BL KB/B&O/Alexa/Xbox Pass),15-fa0073TX
Review: Have brought it for 72k a few days back.Setup: As soon as I brought have updated all the drivers.I connect it to the 244hz monitor and external keyboard and mouse (Razer). Placed On a well ventilated laptop stand.Performance: I'd say it's too good for my regular usage and playing valorat i could get 500fps. Have been using business class laptops for a longtime but the experience of this device is at another level.I don't have any lid wobbling issues or no heating issues at all. The screen is gorgeous.Btw, this is a huge laptop with a big power brick.Strudy build quality, typical HP.The real value for money.

If I need to upgrade the storage, I need to remove the existing 512GB storage and add a new one. Also, the storage in there is not HP's and it is Samsung. Think I got some refurbished laptop for brand new laptop's price. Feeling cheated and demoralizing that I made a wrong decision for purchasing from Amazon. I am not wanting to give 1 star, but I am doing it because it won't allow me to submit this review. Thank you very much for gaining profit through my loss.

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: Happy that it plays the latest game which had altogether become unplayable on my previous laptop(Dell Inspiron 3543). Plus really enjoyed the graphics - almost felt 100Ks are well spent. Games I tried so far are BattleField 1 and 5.But heats up very quickly in Balanced Mode while playing. So I did not even dare to try the Turbo mode. More specifically, the issue is that one of the path the heat dissipates through is from right hand side panel near where I keep my mouse. The heat comes directly on the mouse hand.As a solution I have started playing by keeping laptop and chair at 45 degree angle to table. That way I let my elbow rest on table and also get a lot of space to move my mouse while keeping my hand distant from right side panel.But otherwise heat control is good while working normally. Battery backup is also too good for me during normal working.All in all good product for less than 100k. I guess it was worth the while to wait this long to buy this model.

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: Only Problem iam facing in this laptop is , whenever screen timeout it goes blank and never wakes up, instead it shutdown, i don't whats the problem,Expect that this laptop is Pure beast, i don't game much ,for gaming i have PC , But for working this laptop is awesome, In silent mode i get 7hrs to 9hrs backup in 1 full charge,which is insane üëç

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: Firstly this is a gaming laptop, and you are not getting better spec wise, at this price range, at least until 2023. I am running AAA titles Horizon Zero Dawn, RDR2 and Elden Ring at Ultra without any issues. Having seen some people complain about things please see below points:-Heating :- Yes the laptop heats up when running heavy games, this is normal, the fans pump a lot of hot air out, this is not gonna win any awards for heat dissipation but it does the job. I have not experienced any thermal throttling despite gaming for 4+ hours continuously. Armory crate profile's can be set up, some come inbuilt to regulate the fan speeds and other settings.WIFI - This comes with WIFI 6, but could have issues with older 2.4 networks. If you are a gamer you are using ethernet anyway so doesn't matter.Expansion: Comes with 2 x 8 GB sticks can upgrade them to 2 x 16 if required in the future. Has 2 X M.2 NVMe 2280 slots so options to add storage is also there.I/O - 3 x USB 3. 1 x HDMI, 1 x USB - C :-You can connect a USB-C dock for additional ports. If you want to use G-Sync you need a USB-C to DP adapter/dock to connect to supported monitor (USB-C only has direct graphics card out)I have used this for 1 month and i am happy with the product.If you want a gaming laptop and don't have enough to buy an ROG of the same spec. This is the way.If you want to buy a laptop for anything other than gaming look elsewhere

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: It gets heated very soon while using GPU, and remember one thing i have used 4 laptop cooling devices but they dont even work properly specially in hot environment like Delhi and central india. It is good for light gaming. i have been using this device since last 3 months still 3 emi left but i loved this device as per my needs. i needed this for coding and application development and it solves this very effectively. screen quality is ok ok. sound is very less.

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: I played rdr 2 on ultra settings. I got 60+ fps. The game was really smooth and without any glitches. Haven't played anymore games yet but I think the performance would be above average in any case. Although speakers could have been better. Had to use earphones/headphones while playing rdr 2 because for me laptop speakers were sort of inaudible.

Review: Gaming was the most important reason for opting this product. So far I have had no problems. Also this is my very first gaming laptop so i dont have any benchmarks to compare with. I have played witcher, God of War, Watch dogs 2 and had no performance issue at all.

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: Overall performance of the Laptop is freaking crazy !when it comes to battery its really great, most of the gaming laptops doesn't  last long but this laptop battery is awesome . Its around 4-6hrs on normal use like browsing, programming etc.Most of the people say there are thermal issues with the laptop but its very decent . Even I played some games like Forza Horizon on my 55inch 4k TV on ultra graphics the performance is mind blowing!! temperatures also decent around 92 degrees. Its better to lift the laptop a little bit up from the ground when  you are gaming.The built quality is really very great.Only thing which I felt a little problematic is the screen(Display) , Its good but not great!On overall basis the laptop is great !!!and I suggest/recommend you to get it....

Product: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, 15.6" (39.62 cm) FHD 144Hz, AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, 6GB RTX¬†3060, Gaming Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/90WHrs Battery/Windows 11/Black/2.30 Kg), FA506QM-HN124W
Review: For editing, 3d modelling, rendering the Ryzen 9 is kinda overkill already. Go for the 3200 MHZ Crucial 16gb + 16gb upgrade, its definitely even more op with 32 gb. I also added a 1 tb NVMIE SSD as it comes with one slot filled with the 512gb, will eventually upgrade it to 2tb +2tb Nvmie later on.Also get a good cooling pad as with any gaming laptop worth its salt temperatures will maintain a highish 90 plus but never over 98 degrees so far. Get a good laptop cooler for it. Battery life is respectable when considering the output. Armor crate software lets you bling out the RGB settings. It also feels extremely solid to hold in the hand.

The CPU temperature reaches 90 degrees sometimes but after turning off boost it stays under 80 degrees in god of war ultra settings!! Which is insane. The customer care was contacted for replacement of defective product on the same day and a technician was scheduled to visit for inspection on 3rd Oct. The technician after inspection told that it will be replaced. Today again when I contacted the customer care executive, I was told that the technician has only mentioned service completed and that now a senior technician will visit for inspection of the defective item on 6th October. Is this the way of dealing with the customer who have ordered a product worth one lakh rupees.. An immediate resolution should be provided.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 Intel Core i3 11th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD IPS Thin & Light Laptop (8GB/512GB SDD/Windows 11/Office 2021/2Yr Warranty/3months Game Pass/Platinum Grey/1.7Kg), 81X800LAIN
Review: This is a replacement laptop purchased after getting the refund of the earlier Lenovo laptop, as the camera went out of order 4 times during warranty. 5th time again happened during extended warranty, but Lenovo agreed to refund full amount, perhaps the same model was not available.  Response of TS and FS teams are very prompt but there is a worst customer care department. It took them almost 15 days to pick up the old laptop, which was lying duly packed by their representative. There is no contact No and chat box to reach CC team while you can get easily get through TS and FS and they are very responsive too. So, be careful not to land up with the CC team of Lenovo for any reason. Having not received any response from CC team, I searched Google and got an escalation e-mail id. After sending a complaint to this e-mail id and they writing a mail to CC team, marking copy to me only, I got response from CC team. It was a horrible experience, as it took almost one month to pick up the laptop and subsequent refund after regular follow up twice a day and sending e-mails. The product and services are good baring CC team, as they do not give you any response to your mail, unless you escalate.

Review: At first I want to say, this is a genuine review about LENOVO IDEAPAD, SLIM-3, i3 11th gen 8gb 512 SSD,At first day I dislike this laptop because the battery goes down from 100 to 27 in a single night with out swtchon it. And also I used this for my Solidworks work which gets laggy a lot, so I setup my mind to return this. The return process is so much difficult here as lenovo guy will come to check for the issues with laptop then it will exchange instead of return. But lately I know that there is a problem with my software.  Because other softwares like Inventor, autocad, fusion 360 and catia are working flawlessly in this laptop. Battery is good. And i cancelled my return immediately.Cons-. Sound should be higher,Display brightness should be a little more,Finger print security is not available.Metal frame will be better if provided..Over all I get this at 37990 in offer and a great deal for now..

Review: Well, this could have been a great deal if the display was a touch better. No complaints otherwise. For the price you are getting a very good processor, memory and storage - 512SSD (Dell doesn't offer this with their i311. Toshiba does have it, but their processor is inferior). Overall, this is the best laptop you can get for the price, if you are not too picky on the display. The display is decent for most home use, but you can see the flaw for example when attending a Teams meeting with a high quality image displayed.

Product: ASUS VivoBook 14, Intel Core i3-1115G4 11th Gen, 14" (35.56 cm) FHD, Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Office 2021/Windows 11 Home/Integrated Graphics/FP Reader/Silver/1.6 kg), X415EA-EK322WS
Review: I'll list the shortcomings first.1) The speakers are under the laptop. So if you put the laptop in the bed or lap, the audio quality will be terrible.2) No ethernet. Even though I bought the laptop for my sister who won't be using ethernet/ lan, it feels weird for old school person like me to not have it.3) The usb c port is very close to the charger. I tried the SanDisk dual drive go (the small one) and it fit perfectly though I was a bit uncomfortable plugging and removing it. Bigger ,bulkier devices will be a no go when charger is connected. Similarly I would have liked 2x usb 3, 1x usb 2 instead of the other way around.Other than this , it's a very fine laptop.1) The display is very nice and punches way above it's price point.2) The keyboard is nice, fingerprint is fast.3) The RAM and SSD are of good quality.4) The weight distribution is even which is very important for a compact laptop. Overall build is also satisfactory.5) The battery life is good now, but we'll have to see it holds the same over time.6) The webcam was surprisingly good, didn't expect that.Overall a very good laptop for students who will use it for reading, creating presentations and consuming media.There was a monsoon offer which offered 1 year extra warranty for 99/ 2 year extra warranty for 999. I took the 2 year one to get total of 3 years. With all that, using card offers , it still came under 35k. So a great deal in my opinion.

Product: ASUS VivoBook 14, Intel Core i3-1115G4 11th Gen, 14" (35.56 cm) FHD, Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Office 2021/Windows 11 Home/Integrated Graphics/FP Reader/Silver/1.6 kg), X415EA-EK322WS
Review: At around 35K or lesser with card offers, this is a good i3 11th gen laptop. Build quality is decent for the price, looks are sleek and elegant.  Asus never disappoints with component quality. I checked -both RAM and SSD is from samsung which is great and SSD is NVMe!, So the boot time is blazing fast, boots in 2-3 seconds. Restart is also very quick.14 inch screen size and quality is ok. Bezels are thin around the display. Display is anti glare, Full HD, IPS panel  and has settings for blue light filter as well, so for 14 inch screen, it's good.Sound is not loud but pretty ok if you want to listen to youtube videos etc.It has one USB 3.2 type C  and other USB 3.2 type A port, HDMI on one side and two USB 2.0 ports on the other side of the laptop. though USB type C port doesn't support charging the laptop through it. so if power adapter fails or power port breaks with time, there is no other way to charge the laptop.Cooling system is unique from other laptops and you have to make sure that you aren't blocking the vents, it takes the air in from the bottom vent on right hand side ( FAN is underneath that vent) and the outlet vent is located on the left side! and due to the design of outlet vent also throws the hot air down as well as horizontally to the side, so you have to make sure it's isnt blocked from the bottom side for proper cooling.Those who are getting heating issues, try throttling the CPU in  Control panel > power options > Change plan settings > Change advanced power settings > Processor Power management >  Maximum Processor state - set max power performance to 70% instead of 100% and in MY ASUS app > Customization > Fan profile > choose Performance mode.Keyboard and touchpad are ok  I always good quality external mouse and keyboard.Fingeprint scanner is very quick. It comes preloaded with windows 11 and MS office which is nice.Maximum RAM capacity is only 12GB but you can upgrade storage by adding SSD etc.There is no LAN RJ-45 port so you will have to buy adapter for that if you want to connect LAN cable.Hope this helps someone.

Product: ASUS VivoBook 14, Intel Core i3-1115G4 11th Gen, 14" (35.56 cm) FHD, Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Office 2021/Windows 11 Home/Integrated Graphics/FP Reader/Silver/1.6 kg), X415EA-EK322WS
Review: This laptop is not for gaming, gamers should buy an laptop that has dedicated graphics card. But this laptop is meant fast in other uses like coding or watching movies. Even when I was creating a website, it didn't hang a lot and the speed was great. Nice laptop, not best for gaming. You can play low end games that don't need Dedicated card but still this Laptop is not for gaming.

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review: I'm writing this review after using 10 days of this laptop. This is the best laptop for gaming under 65k but there are some pros & cons of this laptop !So considering everything I'll sum up with few points this is good laptop just have to highlight 2-3 things.1 - The battery backup is very poor it hardly stays upto 1.5-2hrs and then will need to plug in for charging so we can continue our work.2 - With this laptop Microsoft office is not provided as freebie will need to buy subscription to work on office works.3 - The sound is not as expected of a gaming laptop also sometimes it has connecting issues with other devices! Overall ignoring above points the laptop is good !

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†This is my first day of using this laptop and already restricted with several shortcomings (comparing to similar priced models) in buying this laptop. I would like to provide my initial findings and I hope my review would help some other potential buyers in deciding whether to buy this model or not1) USB-C is only for data connectivity, no display or charging (thunderbolt) features available. The description of this laptop's feature is purposefully left vague to confuse buyers into buying it. There are few models of this same laptop with these features but not this one.2) User can't upgrade HDD/RAM modules with out voiding warranty. There is a warranty void sticker in the back which voids warranty if the user opened the back panel. I called up acer support and they also confirmed me that owner shouldn't open the back panel if they want to retain warranty. Acer seems to made sure secondary business to service center so that one has to pay for this upgrade service.3) Speaker output seems to be low and not good enough for a gaming laptop.I wish Acer, seller and Amazon to provide open descriptions on their products so that buyers can take an informed decision. I feel I got somewhat misled on the product description on its available features.Comparing with Acer Aspire 5 which has thunderbolt 4 (with display out and usb-c charging), 1240P processor, 2050 RTX GPU. This model is better only in aesthetics, screen refresh rate and may be thermal management, so if you are really going to compare, Aspire 5/7 is a better option to purchase at this price level. This is only my opinion but each individuals preference might differ.Edited after using for 1 month:I got the screen flickering issue that some of the reviewers mentioned here. Initially I thought of contacting Acer support but decided to try some options before that. I have uninstalled the inbuilt VGA driver and restarted Laptop.  Windows automatically installed a new driver for the inbuilt VGA and since that I  didn't see the same issue, hope it fixed the issue. If the issue reoccurs I may have to contact Acer support.One more important thing to consider, never trust the Amazon Pay ICICI card to pay back 5% as reward. They used to pay rewards regularly for few months but when I made high valued purchases they simply held the reward points for few months saying there is some technical glitch and later gave lame reasons for not paying the reward. Whereas when I missed to payment for a few days they calculated interest @42% from the beginning for the previous cycle and charged heftily as interest. Lesson learnt: Never trust credit card company. They make biased mistakes for their benefit

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review: I am writing this review after 3 months of use.Overall this laptop is good .Gaming Performance fineCAD  software working well.MS officeEverything is fine till date .But sometime screen start blinking that's the negative thing I face in this laptop .Battery Backup is Poor running time is less if you are running game or watching movie or something else Battery backup poor .

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review: Acer Nitro 5 is something i would always recommend under 50-60k. I got it for 49.5k approx during great indian festival sale. And trust me it can satisfy your needs for sure. I do gaming all the time and give me one AAA game i can't play on this machine. I bet you can't. I've used some softwares like for 3D rendering and it never lagged. I've a i5 11th gen 512gb ssd 8GB Ram variant. It has given me a significant performance of 48 fps in cyberpunk and 35 fps in RDR 2. Valorant or Gta 5 100+fps at high settings. Spiderman remastered and miles morales hell yeah 70+ fps on medium setting. The experience is smooth but battery backup is not a thing in this laptop. And  I'm fine with it. I stay at home play games. No problem. But like if you set it on low performance + battery saver it could give 2.5-3 hr backup. And with full power 1 hr. But i would recommend it over lenevo or asus or any other acer laptop. It's better then acer aspire 7 i5 12th gen which come in the same budget and let's be honest it's not a legit gaminf laptop it's more like a hybrid. Go for this one. I vouch for it anytime.

¬†The ips panels are of very low quality, my original unit had screen bleed and dead pixels so got a replacement for it, and the latest lap does have screen bleed more than the acceptable level. Another drawback is the speaker volume, the volume is too low to hear.Battery power  only lasted for 2.5 hours while watching a movie at full screen brightness.Pros,Good thermals,Tested with NFS Payback, rise of the tomb raider, ac unity. The maximum cpu temperature was 78¬∞c and GPU 68¬∞c. Most of the time the temperatures were between 60 to 70 while gaming.The gaming performance is also good. Got 50 to  60 fps at 1080p maximum settings for all the 3 games tested.i5 11400h is with GTX 1650 is a good option for gaming at this price range.The reason that I still keeping this laptop is just because of its specs( i5 11400h 6 core 12 thread,) and upgradable capabilities that too under 60k budget. But be aware you can't upgrade urself without voiding the warrenty.So in conclusion, the only good thing that I found with this laptop is 6 core i5 and good thermals, the similar laptops within this price range are still coming with 10th Gen i5 4 core. And ryzen 5 5600h is another option.

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review: I am sharing my experience after this product for approximately 20 days. I'll keep it short future buyers keep this in notice : service provided by Amazon is appreciable. I expect 14 days return period is bit less. I ordered this laptop and screen bleed issue, got it replaced by Amazon received the replacement device on time. But still the issue persist in the replacement. Its not Amazon's issue the packaging was outstanding there was no chance to get the device damaged. So I had to reach out to manufacturer "ACER" services provided by Acer is very poor technical person was really adamant for not accepting the issue. Even after showing these pictures he said this is normal. I wrote an email and the response I got acer was a link which states "What causes Backlight Bleeding" as it was clearly mentioned on their website so I was left with no other option except accepting the device as it is. So my personal suggestion would spend a bit more money and go for a better version and of course no Acer please!! This is because of after service they provide.  After purchasing my laptop I checked the screens of HP pavillion, Asus TUF gaming F17, Lenovo Legion 5, Dell Gaming G5 and didn't find this issue also I had a word with Dell customer service they are really helpful and was able to sense their attention towards a concern. So my PS would be spend a bit more but get a better laptop.

Review: I'm writing this review after using 10 days of this laptop. This is the best laptop for gaming under 65k but there are some pros & cons of this laptop !So considering everything I'll sum up with few points this is good laptop just have to highlight 2-3 things.1 - The battery backup is very poor it hardly stays upto 1.5-2hrs and then will need to plug in for charging so we can continue our work.2 - With this laptop Microsoft office is not provided as freebie will need to buy subscription to work on office works.3 - The sound is not as expected of a gaming laptop also sometimes it has connecting issues with other devices! Overall ignoring above points the laptop is good !

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†This is my first day of using this laptop and already restricted with several shortcomings (comparing to similar priced models) in buying this laptop. I would like to provide my initial findings and I hope my review would help some other potential buyers in deciding whether to buy this model or not1) USB-C is only for data connectivity, no display or charging (thunderbolt) features available. The description of this laptop's feature is purposefully left vague to confuse buyers into buying it. There are few models of this same laptop with these features but not this one.2) User can't upgrade HDD/RAM modules with out voiding warranty. There is a warranty void sticker in the back which voids warranty if the user opened the back panel. I called up acer support and they also confirmed me that owner shouldn't open the back panel if they want to retain warranty. Acer seems to made sure secondary business to service center so that one has to pay for this upgrade service.3) Speaker output seems to be low and not good enough for a gaming laptop.I wish Acer, seller and Amazon to provide open descriptions on their products so that buyers can take an informed decision. I feel I got somewhat misled on the product description on its available features.Comparing with Acer Aspire 5 which has thunderbolt 4 (with display out and usb-c charging), 1240P processor, 2050 RTX GPU. This model is better only in aesthetics, screen refresh rate and may be thermal management, so if you are really going to compare, Aspire 5/7 is a better option to purchase at this price level. This is only my opinion but each individuals preference might differ.Edited after using for 1 month:I got the screen flickering issue that some of the reviewers mentioned here. Initially I thought of contacting Acer support but decided to try some options before that. I have uninstalled the inbuilt VGA driver and restarted Laptop.  Windows automatically installed a new driver for the inbuilt VGA and since that I  didn't see the same issue, hope it fixed the issue. If the issue reoccurs I may have to contact Acer support.One more important thing to consider, never trust the Amazon Pay ICICI card to pay back 5% as reward. They used to pay rewards regularly for few months but when I made high valued purchases they simply held the reward points for few months saying there is some technical glitch and later gave lame reasons for not paying the reward. Whereas when I missed to payment for a few days they calculated interest @42% from the beginning for the previous cycle and charged heftily as interest. Lesson learnt: Never trust credit card company. They make biased mistakes for their benefit

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review: I am writing this review after 3 months of use.Overall this laptop is good .Gaming Performance fineCAD  software working well.MS officeEverything is fine till date .But sometime screen start blinking that's the negative thing I face in this laptop .Battery Backup is Poor running time is less if you are running game or watching movie or something else Battery backup poor .

Product: Acer Nitro 5 Gaming Laptop Intel Core i5-11400H 11th Gen Processor (16GB/512GB SSD/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 Graphics/Windows 11 Home/RGB),AN515-57 with 15.6"(39.6cm) FHD 144Hz IPS Display
Review: Acer Nitro 5 is something i would always recommend under 50-60k. I got it for 49.5k approx during great indian festival sale. And trust me it can satisfy your needs for sure. I do gaming all the time and give me one AAA game i can't play on this machine. I bet you can't. I've used some softwares like for 3D rendering and it never lagged. I've a i5 11th gen 512gb ssd 8GB Ram variant. It has given me a significant performance of 48 fps in cyberpunk and 35 fps in RDR 2. Valorant or Gta 5 100+fps at high settings. Spiderman remastered and miles morales hell yeah 70+ fps on medium setting. The experience is smooth but battery backup is not a thing in this laptop. And  I'm fine with it. I stay at home play games. No problem. But like if you set it on low performance + battery saver it could give 2.5-3 hr backup. And with full power 1 hr. But i would recommend it over lenevo or asus or any other acer laptop. It's better then acer aspire 7 i5 12th gen which come in the same budget and let's be honest it's not a legit gaminf laptop it's more like a hybrid. Go for this one. I vouch for it anytime.

The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†The ips panels are of very low quality, my original unit had screen bleed and dead pixels so got a replacement for it, and the latest lap does have screen bleed more than the acceptable level. Another drawback is the speaker volume, the volume is too low to hear.Battery power  only lasted for 2.5 hours while watching a movie at full screen brightness.Pros,Good thermals,Tested with NFS Payback, rise of the tomb raider, ac unity. The maximum cpu temperature was 78¬∞c and GPU 68¬∞c. Most of the time the temperatures were between 60 to 70 while gaming.The gaming performance is also good. Got 50 to  60 fps at 1080p maximum settings for all the 3 games tested.i5 11400h is with GTX 1650 is a good option for gaming at this price range.The reason that I still keeping this laptop is just because of its specs( i5 11400h 6 core 12 thread,) and upgradable capabilities that too under 60k budget. But be aware you can't upgrade urself without voiding the warrenty.So in conclusion, the only good thing that I found with this laptop is 6 core i5 and good thermals, the similar laptops within this price range are still coming with 10th Gen i5 4 core. And ryzen 5 5600h is another option.

Review: I am sharing my experience after this product for approximately 20 days. I'll keep it short future buyers keep this in notice : service provided by Amazon is appreciable. I expect 14 days return period is bit less. I ordered this laptop and screen bleed issue, got it replaced by Amazon received the replacement device on time. But still the issue persist in the replacement. Its not Amazon's issue the packaging was outstanding there was no chance to get the device damaged. So I had to reach out to manufacturer "ACER" services provided by Acer is very poor technical person was really adamant for not accepting the issue. Even after showing these pictures he said this is normal. I wrote an email and the response I got acer was a link which states "What causes Backlight Bleeding" as it was clearly mentioned on their website so I was left with no other option except accepting the device as it is. So my personal suggestion would spend a bit more money and go for a better version and of course no Acer please!! This is because of after service they provide.  After purchasing my laptop I checked the screens of HP pavillion, Asus TUF gaming F17, Lenovo Legion 5, Dell Gaming G5 and didn't find this issue also I had a word with Dell customer service they are really helpful and was able to sense their attention towards a concern. So my PS would be spend a bit more but get a better laptop.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 1 Intel Celeron N4020 11.6" (29.46cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (4GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Platinum Grey/1.2Kg), 81VT0071IN
Review: Config: Celeron 4020, 4GB RAM, 720p camera, Win 11, MS Office 2021What I like:This laptop allows me to do most of my work: emails, word processing, basic presentations and excel. It comes with the latest MS Office pre-installed, which is great (not the 365 trial/1-year subscription junk). What I love the most about it though is the weight. I honestly don't care that it's plastic. It is a relief to my arms, shoulder and back. Yes, the screen-size (11") can be a bit annoying at times, but I bought it for the portability, so I was aware that a compromise will be involved. That said, for the size of the laptop, the keyboard is spectacular. It is one thing that Lenovo does extraordinarily well.Another point in its favour is its price. I am scared of busting up my "primary" laptop due to poor electric connections with random voltage surges in places outside of Mumbai. This laptop serves. It is cheap enough for me not to have a heart attack if something fries, and I find myself relying more and more on this cheap dude than my MacBook Pro (i5, 8GB, 512 SSD), which of course is the (significantly) superior machine.Battery life is tolerable - I am not a heavy user, so my battery lasts about 3 days without charge (at about 1-2 hours of use daily). Sound's good too...What I don't like:The screen quality, but hey, its a sub-22k machine (or at least that is what I bough it at. If it's higher right now, wait for a sale...)The track-pad  performance - it is okay in general, but when dragging things around a bit and doing image intensive tasks, it lags/misbehaves a little. This is more likely due to the under-powered processor than the trackpad, though...

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 1 Intel Celeron N4020 11.6" (29.46cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (4GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Platinum Grey/1.2Kg), 81VT0071IN
Review: No Tax Invoice received. Sticker pasted on back side of laptop is not visible and does not have S/N  Send Tax Invoice with detail of product S/N

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 1 Intel Celeron N4020 11.6" (29.46cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (4GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Platinum Grey/1.2Kg), 81VT0071IN
Review: DECENTLY FAST LAPTOP ONCE YOU SET IT UP!First: Once you start it after unboxing and set up the windows, it will perform slow for a bit. Don't worry. Go into settings, windows update, and download all updates & restart to install the downloaded updates. This will take some time. Be patient.Second: When all windows updates are installed and the OS is upto date, for the time being, uninstall bloatwares like Prime video, Instagram, WhatsApp, xbox etc. Clean it up as much as possible by removing unnecessary apps. Set up McAfee Live Safe by opening it up from app tray.Third: Most importantly, this machine comes with Windows S mode i.e. you can only download apps from MS Store. If you want a decently fast machine, stay in the S mode. Forget Chrome, use Edge browser built in. Its based on chromium only. If you want to slow the machine down, Google how to get out of S mode.Conclusion: For the price (similar to a chromebook) it is a good laptop for browsing on Edge browser, YouTube, Netflix, Prime video, MS office, MS Teams, Zoom etc. All this can be done in S mode smoothly.Update: At this price point, the keyboard is of really good quality. Typing experience is good. Amongst the chromebooks and Travelmate and other laptops at this price & size, I think this was a good choice for me. Feels premium compared to others and works well for my usecase.

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 1 Intel Celeron N4020 11.6" (29.46cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (4GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Platinum Grey/1.2Kg), 81VT0071IN
Review: After 3 months of use, feels like it is OK product at this price. Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 1 Intel Celeron N4020 11.6" (29.46cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (4GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Platinum Grey/1.2Kg), 81VT0071IN
Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 1 Intel Celeron N4020 11.6" (29.46cm) HD Thin & Light Laptop (4GB/256 GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Platinum Grey/1.2Kg), 81VT0071IN
Review: Not for Gamers, High End Programmers, Multimedia Photo/Video Editors, CAD/CAM Users.Compactness and small in size is key feature that will amaze you.Recommendation1. Suitable for students2. Programmers can install lightweight IDE like VS code3. Don't think of installing DB packages like Oracle, MySQL, MSSQL Server as their process keep running which will eat up memory RAM.4. Ideal to keep this laptop if you have a high end desktop too. Intall big stuff there and work on either of your devices per your mobility needs. Like installing DB on desktop and doing development on this laptop.5. Heavy multi tasking is not recommended i.e. keeping many applications running in taskbar must be avoided. Plan your work and divide and concur. Open application that is needed now and close once done.6. Personal experience I keep Mail, MS Teams, VS Code for a 3000+ Java code files project, Few word and excel documents, Browser with average 8-10 tabs open and this doesn't lag.UpgradableRAM - no as this soldered to the motherboardSSD - Yes as this has NVMe PCIe Gen 3 SSD with M-key. Form Factor: 2242. The slot can also support 2280 SSD upto 2TB (I will post review once I upgrade) Further Update 05-Feb-2022 - the NVMe 2TB SSD upgrade successful and this works like charm.Best featuresDual band wifi5 ac protocol that gives immense speed and full utilization of my 100mbps connection.Touch and feel like a premium laptop, smooth finish, fine edges.Large keyboard keys doesn't feel clumsy.Enough large touchpad too.Good battery backup between 4 - 6 hours depending upon brightness, process laptop is doing and WiFi usage while running on battery.

Product: Acer Aspire 3 AMD A3020e Dual Core Processor (4GB RAM/256GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/ AMD Radeon Graphics/Black/1.9 Kg) A314-22 with 14 inches (35.5 cm) HD Laptop
Review: Got this against an exchange offer by paying Rs 18000+. Terrible camera and even more terrible sound output. Heck, my 12 year old Acer Travelmate i3 was much better than this, but let bygones by bygones. Full of bloatware, which makes the  new laptop almost non-functional. MS Office is loaded, which has a 5 day's license. Better not to have provided it. Windows 11 Home edition and Acer junkware further take up computing space. Took a week to update Windows 11 and all drivers. Removed the junkware one by one, including MS Office. Disabled Windows update, removed all crap including a program named Clipchamp. Removed all Acer apps. Still, apps like Agoda and Amazon won't go away. But at least the laptop is responding now. Initially, it just refused to respond, due to tons of unwanted services operating in the background.Hardware wise, nothing wrong. 4GB RAM is upgradable to 12 GB, by adding 8 GB DDR4. But will the warranty become void, if the system is opened now? No answers. At best OK for MS Office 2007 applications and routine surfing. Having a laptop for face value. No great expectations.Update: THIS IS NOT UPGRADABLE TO 12 GB RAM. It has only one slot, occupied with 4 GB stick. That has to be removed and fresh 8GB stick inserted. Also its speed is outdated 2400. Beware!!Windows 11 is hogging 3.5 GB RAM so the laptop is unresponsive most of the time. After upgrading to 8GB, it is responding somewhat. Original 4 RAM stick wasted.

Product: Acer Aspire 3 AMD A3020e Dual Core Processor (4GB RAM/256GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/ AMD Radeon Graphics/Black/1.9 Kg) A314-22 with 14 inches (35.5 cm) HD Laptop
Review: Got this for my dad, for his office work.If you get this laptop, make sure to remove all the pre-installed acer software. This slowed down the laptop considerably, using 100% of both the cpu and the disk. The biggest culprit was some random P2P enhance software. Not sure why companies do this, especially if it makes their product unusable.If you have money to spare, go for the SSD version, and a little more ram, it will be much faster.Barring that, the laptop works as intended.Don't expect amazing performance, it will only be good for office or school work, or for watching videos.The image quality is so so, it's not even a 1080p screen, which was disappointing at the price and in this day and age. The colors are not great, might need some calibration, but it'll do for regular use.With only 4gb ram you can't use chrome, best to stick with firefox or any other lightweight browser. If you have the money, upgrade the ram or go for a model with at least 8gb.Upgradability wise, according to the description you can add a m.2 SSD and upto 12gb of ram, which is fair. I took the hdd variant for more storage, but it would be better to go for the faster SSD version, and add a hdd after.This is not a gaming laptop in any way, if you want that please look elsewhere.

Product: Acer Aspire 3 AMD A3020e Dual Core Processor (4GB RAM/256GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/ AMD Radeon Graphics/Black/1.9 Kg) A314-22 with 14 inches (35.5 cm) HD Laptop
Review: This is such a slow system. And it keeps hanging. I got it in the evening and informed them about its defect. I was told to download service app. They tried to guide me through it but system was so slow that they quit after half an hour of waiting. Told me to go download 42 drivers from the internet and install them. So I download 42 drivers.i have to do captcha for each one. Then I have to install them. Then update system. I was doing this till late night. Then I just slept. Next day I tried, system was a bit better but still very slow, especially for a new system. Now I'm trying to get it returned/replaced, which is another headache.

Product: Acer Extensa 15 Lightweight Laptop Intel Core i3 11th Gen Processor - (8 GB/ 512 GB SSD/ Windows 11 Home/ 1.7kg/ Black/ Elevated Hinge Design) EX215-54 with 39.6 cm (15.6 inches) FHD Display
Review: Everything  good in this laptop

Product: Acer Extensa 15 Lightweight Laptop Intel Core i3 11th Gen Processor - (8 GB/ 512 GB SSD/ Windows 11 Home/ 1.7kg/ Black/ Elevated Hinge Design) EX215-54 with 39.6 cm (15.6 inches) FHD Display
Review: Well, it may or may not be the future of laptops, but on this one at least you are stuckup with win11 home to the end it seems as you cannot boot from any other device (usb flash / dvd drives) unless it is a rescue disc created by the running win 11 system, the bios boot option is one and only one "windows boot manager'!  which in itself is not a device and you cannot change this by any means (I have tried all possible ways, it is not possible)  so if you are happy with it, then purchase it else not.Performance as it is can be termed as very goodMs Office home , norton antivirus is pre installed without license so you have to purchase a license key additionally if you wish to use these beyond the trial period of a few daysI am totally disappointed not for the performance but because I like to be in full control of the device which in this case is not possible so only 2 stars for the product as it boots up and shuts down as expected off an ssd.After 2 days of struggle I called acer service  to make it possible to boot from usb devices and the service person visited and  whatever he tried (mostly changes in bios security settings) simply made the pre loaded win 11 also non bootable and not repairable, as per my habit I had a rescue disk already made out of the installed system and a backup image prepared from the win 11 in spite of which the operating system remained useless and I had to go back to a fresh install of windows 10 from my own win 10 install media and then upgrade to win 11.After 2 months :After lot many tries I've found out that fedora 34 onwards can be installed from usb drives on this hardware and may be other uefi compatible ones too may get working on it. The performance is fine so I am increasing the rating from 2 to 4 stars now, 1 star less for absence of "caps lock, num lock, BT etc. " indicators on kbd and a narrow viewing angle for the quality FHD (1920 X 1080)  resolution .

Male sure to upgrade this laptop with 16 GB of additional RAM of 2400 MHz to maximize performance. Also I have maxed out in configuration by having wifi 6 card , 1 tb ssd and 1 tb NVME installed in the Laptop. It costed me around ‚Çπ48000/- with all these upgrade so at this price point it is good. Battery is also good initially. Now at this time it is giving me around 4-5 hours backup easily on battery . The biggest advantage is the screensize which is aclear win here. So anyone who is tight on budget and looking to upgrade the laptop later please don't hesitate to get this one and upgrade later.

Product: Lenovo E41-55 AMD 14-inch HD 220 Nits Antiglare Thin and Light Laptop (AMD Athlon A3150U/4GB RAM/1TB HDD/DOS/Integrated AMD Graphics/Grey/1 Year Onsite/1.59 kg), 82FJ00ALIH
Review: This machine in its permissible specs, is not built for Windows 11. I only realised it, after upgrading to maximum RAM the motherboard allows, which is 16GB.I was running Windows 11 at its maximum performance settings, disabling anything which would slow the machine down. But, still it was laggy.So, I decided to clean install Windows 10 on it. Since the Windows 11 key is embedded to the motherboard, I did not need a new key for Windows 10. The OS after installation activated on its own.Now, it runs fabulous, no lags, and there was no need to disable anything.So, now I am happy. The laptop is super compact, super fast and looks like built to last.

Product: ASUS Vivobook 14, Intel Core i3-1115G4 11th Gen, 14" (35.56 cm) FHD, Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Office 2021/Windows 11 Home/Integrated Graphics/FP Reader/Silver/1.6 kg), X415EA-EB322WS
Review: I'll list the shortcomings first.1) The speakers are under the laptop. So if you put the laptop in the bed or lap, the audio quality will be terrible.2) No ethernet. Even though I bought the laptop for my sister who won't be using ethernet/ lan, it feels weird for old school person like me to not have it.3) The usb c port is very close to the charger. I tried the SanDisk dual drive go (the small one) and it fit perfectly though I was a bit uncomfortable plugging and removing it. Bigger ,bulkier devices will be a no go when charger is connected. Similarly I would have liked 2x usb 3, 1x usb 2 instead of the other way around.Other than this , it's a very fine laptop.1) The display is very nice and punches way above it's price point.2) The keyboard is nice, fingerprint is fast.3) The RAM and SSD are of good quality.4) The weight distribution is even which is very important for a compact laptop. Overall build is also satisfactory.5) The battery life is good now, but we'll have to see it holds the same over time.6) The webcam was surprisingly good, didn't expect that.Overall a very good laptop for students who will use it for reading, creating presentations and consuming media.There was a monsoon offer which offered 1 year extra warranty for 99/ 2 year extra warranty for 999. I took the 2 year one to get total of 3 years. With all that, using card offers , it still came under 35k. So a great deal in my opinion.

Review: Detailed review after 2 1.5 years of usage!Never buy anything from brand avita. Their website is shut down. There customer care phone number is out of service. Am sure they might soon close their Opera in india.And as for i am concerned, i bought a avita liber v14 laptop last year with i5 10th gen processor as the warranty was 2 years, while other giants like lenovo, asus, dell provide only 1 year and it had some screen issues recently. I booked a complaint and i can't even contact the customer care because their website is shutdown and call is never connected. The engineer from their 3rd party service provider "Nextgo" visited my house, he had 0 skills and post screen replacement the camera stopped working. now i visited the service centre recently and they replaced the webcam thrice in the last 10 days and the webcam is still not working and the service centre says that the brand is not providing spare parts and they are of no help. 45k of my hard earned money went in vain now.Its better to go with bigger brands like dell, hp, asus, lenovo etc by shelling some extra money as they provide excellent service and spares!Never look for Saving those mere 5-10k and go for wanna be brands like AVITA!

Product: Acer Aspire 3 AMD 3020e Dual core Processor (4GB DDR4 RAM / 1TB HDD / Windows 11 Home/ Black /Narrow Bezel / 1.9 Kg) A314-22 with 14 inches (35.5 cm) HD Display Laptop
Review: Got this against an exchange offer by paying Rs 18000+. Terrible camera and even more terrible sound output. Heck, my 12 year old Acer Travelmate i3 was much better than this, but let bygones by bygones. Full of bloatware, which makes the  new laptop almost non-functional. MS Office is loaded, which has a 5 day's license. Better not to have provided it. Windows 11 Home edition and Acer junkware further take up computing space. Took a week to update Windows 11 and all drivers. Removed the junkware one by one, including MS Office. Disabled Windows update, removed all crap including a program named Clipchamp. Removed all Acer apps. Still, apps like Agoda and Amazon won't go away. But at least the laptop is responding now. Initially, it just refused to respond, due to tons of unwanted services operating in the background.Hardware wise, nothing wrong. 4GB RAM is upgradable to 12 GB, by adding 8 GB DDR4. But will the warranty become void, if the system is opened now? No answers. At best OK for MS Office 2007 applications and routine surfing. Having a laptop for face value. No great expectations.Update: THIS IS NOT UPGRADABLE TO 12 GB RAM. It has only one slot, occupied with 4 GB stick. That has to be removed and fresh 8GB stick inserted. Also its speed is outdated 2400. Beware!!Windows 11 is hogging 3.5 GB RAM so the laptop is unresponsive most of the time. After upgrading to 8GB, it is responding somewhat. Original 4 RAM stick wasted.

Product: Acer Aspire 3 AMD 3020e Dual core Processor (4GB DDR4 RAM / 1TB HDD / Windows 11 Home/ Black /Narrow Bezel / 1.9 Kg) A314-22 with 14 inches (35.5 cm) HD Display Laptop
Review: Got this for my dad, for his office work.If you get this laptop, make sure to remove all the pre-installed acer software. This slowed down the laptop considerably, using 100% of both the cpu and the disk. The biggest culprit was some random P2P enhance software. Not sure why companies do this, especially if it makes their product unusable.If you have money to spare, go for the SSD version, and a little more ram, it will be much faster.Barring that, the laptop works as intended.Don't expect amazing performance, it will only be good for office or school work, or for watching videos.The image quality is so so, it's not even a 1080p screen, which was disappointing at the price and in this day and age. The colors are not great, might need some calibration, but it'll do for regular use.With only 4gb ram you can't use chrome, best to stick with firefox or any other lightweight browser. If you have the money, upgrade the ram or go for a model with at least 8gb.Upgradability wise, according to the description you can add a m.2 SSD and upto 12gb of ram, which is fair. I took the hdd variant for more storage, but it would be better to go for the faster SSD version, and add a hdd after.This is not a gaming laptop in any way, if you want that please look elsewhere.

Product: Lenovo ThinkBook 15 Intel 11th Gen Core i3 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD 220 nits Antiglare Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/256GB SSD/Windows 11/MS Office/Mineral Grey/1.7 Kg), 20VEA0YQIH
Review: I got my laptop delivered today. I am surprised how can the warranty start on June 2022. And the warranty left is only 6 months out of 1year. Did I purchase an used product? Want a reply from the seller.

Product: Lenovo ThinkBook 15 Intel 11th Gen Core i3 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD 220 nits Antiglare Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/256GB SSD/Windows 11/MS Office/Mineral Grey/1.7 Kg), 20VEA0YQIH
Review: This is a decent laptop that is meeting my expectations so far. I have been using it for over a month now and here are my observations.1. Screen: The vertical viewing angle on the screen is not good. Horizontal viewing angles are ok. Once set at a comfortable angle, the screen is good at full HD. Resolution and magnification can be adjusted in settings.2. Battery life: Decent battery life of 4-6 hours. What I do mostly consists of browsing, YouTube, small programming projects and mostly basic tasks and it fulfils my needs.3. Design and build: Loving the all metallic build, even if it is on the heavier side a little. Feels very sturdy.4. Hardware/Software: Windows 11 runs smoothly with i3 11th gen, 8GB RAM and 256GB SSD. Booting up is fast, within seconds and all actions like app opening and switching are snappy.5. Ports and Connections: carries all the basic ports and connectivity features. So, no issues here.6. Weight: a little on the heavier side but being a 14" body, it is more convenient to carry than other larger laptops. This is in no way comparable with ultrabooks or light weight notebooks. Availability of all the ports justifies the weight.Overall, if you are in the market for a good laptop that handles basic tasks well, this is a good buy! No complaints so far. You get what you pay for! I have looked around and there are very few good configurations in the 30K - 40K price range. This is one of those few laptops sitting in the range and I believe I made the right choice. Thanks to Amazon for the timely delivery.

SSD and RAM can be expanded at anytime.Cons: Screen is not that great. You have to adjust the screen to the correct vertical viewing angle to get the optimal colour.Overall i would give 4.5/5

Product: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 Intel Celeron N4020 4th Gen 15.6" (39.62cm) HD 220nits Anti-Glare (8GB/256GB SDD/Windows 11/Office 2021/2Yr Warranty/3months Game Pass/Platinum Grey/1.7Kg), 81WQ00NXIN
Review: At features and price, this is a good laptop. The screen quality is decent and the setup is convenient. This is running Celeron, so obviously there's no gaming for this machine. It's unfortunate, but that three month game pass is pretty much useless. MS Office setup is easy and straightforward.There are a few negatives. First, the wire going from the laptop to the screen is very visible at the hinge. This is a potential point of failure and I think it will affect the life of the laptop.Another annoying aspect is the continuous upselling attempts by Lenovo. The laptop includes Lenovo Vantage software, which could be necessary for some aspects like firmware updates. However, Lenovo keeps pushing users to buy additional software coverage, including by throwing popups on the screen while you work.Some annoying issues, but I think it's overall a good laptop.

At this price range all other brands have backlit keyboard, and fingerprint identification and some of them are also aluminum made and look very premium. With about the same money (59 K) you can buy ASUS Vivobook with OLED screen of 600 knits and all of the above. You should not give more than 40 K for this laptop. It is not a value for this money.
